title: Dialogflow - Speech models
abstract:
# Dialogflow - Speech models
Dialogflow voice agents use [Speech-to-Text](/speech-to-text/docs) for speech recognition, which is included in [Dialogflow pricing](/dialogflow/pricing) . Dialogflow automatically selects a speech recognition model for you, but you can optionally specify the model.
content:
## Available models
All available models are listed at [Speech-to-Text models](/speech-to-text/docs/transcription-model) . Select a model that is best suited to your domain and [supports your agent language and speech features](/speech-to-text/docs/speech-to-text-supported-languages) .
If a model is not explicitly [specified](#specify) , then Dialogflow auto-selects a model based on the audio configuration in API requests and agent settings.
[enhanced speech model](/dialogflow/es/docs/speech-enhanced-models)
The following models typically have the best performance:
- telephony_short (best for telephony Dialogflow)
- telephony (best for Agent Assist)
- phone_call (good for Agent Assist and telephony Dialogflow)
- latest_short (best for non-telephony Dialogflow)
- command_and_search (best for languages where other models are not available)## Specify a model
`detectIntent`
`streamingDetectIntent`
[Sessions](/dialogflow/es/docs/reference/common-types#sessions)
[ConversationProfile](/dialogflow/es/docs/reference/rpc/google.cloud.dialogflow.v2#google.cloud.dialogflow.v2.ConversationProfile)
[Agent Assist](/agent-assist/docs)
**Note:** If you specify the model with a conversation profile, Agent Assist and the associated virtual agent use this model for all speech recognition.
